result.title: Objective
result.description: Promotion of environmentally sustainable transport system in Metropolitan Managua

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1) Reduction of CO2 emissions caused by public transport by 13 %

baseline.comment: 1) Nearly all the buses in charge of public transportation inside metropolitan area are more than 20 years old

target.comment: 1) All the buses in metropolitan area are having at least the motor type E 3

actual.comment: At June 2015, all buses of public transportation in Managua were renewed with Euro 3 motor tech, this will result in a reduction 12.65% of CO2 emission. In the next time the policy should aim to have other types of public transportation such as BRT and units with Euro 5 motor tech. Also is necessary a national policy for a sustainable public transportation.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2) The change in percentage of environmentally efficient public transportation units and bicycles with respect to total amount of vehicles

baseline.comment: 2) The amount of bicycles was 35000 in 2008 an total amount of vehicles 215000. In agreement with these figures the baseline is 16%. We take only the bicycles because the buses are the old buses

target.comment: 2) There exist 49 kilometers of comfortable walking, bicycling routes and they are actively promoted as mean of transport.

actual.comment: According with the project calculations, is an estimated 52% of clean energy vehicles, is the relationship between bikes and vehicles motorized. There is no officials statistic for a clean vehicle but the team project is working with Comite Vial and MARENA in order to define a policy to clean energy vehicles.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Implementation of a new legal and operational framework for public transportation in Metropolitan Managua

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1) Percentage of bus routes operating under new regulations orders in Metropolitan area (3 municipalities)

target.comment: 1) 100% of bus routes operating under new regulations.

actual.comment: The legal framework there is a new regulation for the Managua Public Transportations Authority (IRTRAMMA) was finished and is expect that will be included in plans of public transport for the second half 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2) A new integrated transport system is in place through the implementation of the new legal framework. There exist one clear authority that is in charge of public transportation in metropolitan area

actual.comment: Still no progress on this indicator. Progress is expected in late 2015 and early 2016. Is in move new sutdies by JICA for land use plan *ordenamiento territorial and ICES BID.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3) The amount of renewed vehicle fleet with the motors of E 3 type or more advanced technology.

target.comment: This outcome has been removed after a substantive revision of the project undertaken in July 2011.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Improved land use planning and traffic management in Metropolitan Managua

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1) The percentages of constructed intersections with cycling routes to improve loading and unloading of passengers.

actual.comment: 40%. Design studies were completed for a total of 30 kms of bike route that included more than 11 points. It works on a constructions models to builds a bike routes.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2) In 3 municipalities integrated transport plan with urban development plan.

actual.comment: 50% advance, studies in 2013 were conducted but still it is not incorporated into plans of public transport. Is expected that Movility Plans for two municipalities will be made in the second half of 2015 and 2016 and JICA / ICIS studies. ...

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3) Exist solutions for all 200 high risk areas for parking

actual.comment: Still 50%. This will be incorporated into the work plans Municipal Transportation in 2015 and 2016.

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Promotion of bicycles as a sustainable and efficient transport alternative

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1) Length of cycling path network (construction of 49KM)

actual.comment: Design studios for 30 kms for bike path have been completed, is being coordinated with municipalities to begin construction. An agrrement between municipalities and project is expected to sign in August and will be star the construction to 25 kms until december 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2) Percentage of growth in number of daily bicycling trips and in number of registered bicycles .

actual.comment: This will be measured once the project finishes the construction of the bike routes.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3) The action plan and close follow system to study and development ways and means to promote bicycling

actual.comment: a citizen participation plan was conducted and its implementation will be in action with the construction plan of bike paths.

result.title: Outcome 5
result.description: Building local capacities, Project replication and monitoring of results

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1) 30 people trained and to have a specialization in environmentally sustainable management of transportation in different leves. At least 250 persons trained in transport administrationa and operations.

actual.comment: 100%. 30 technician of institutions related to the project were trained in sustainable transportation in 2013 and another training in GHG Emissions Calculations for 35 techs was made for institutions partner with the project.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2) Number of other municipalities replicating the actions plans and cycling route activities.

actual.comment: 10%. The team project was initiated a program for 6 municipalities, actually work with 2 of them Nindiri and Mateare.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3) Number of Project Management Reports and other studies carried out to evaluate and monitor the project execution. Also the number of reports and minutes of each board meeting and each advisory council meeting

actual.comment: 90%. 36 reports were made in 2012, 13, 14 and 6 in 2015. The MTE was realized and approved for a Project Steering Committee/Board and Advisory Committee. Also financial audit was performed.

iati-activity.description: Resilience oriented information systems for improved decision making. (Programa de Sistemas de información para la Resiliencia en Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional de la region del SICA-PROGRESAN-SICA).

iati-activity.title: Resilience oriented informatio
iati-activity.description: Improved availability of regular, timely and early warning information as well as evidence-based analysis regarding to food and nutrition security, nutrition and resilience situation for decision making.
